page.title: 03CHURCHES IN MAWNAN
page.content: {St. Michael's Church}was built in the village in 1874. It was built because the Old Church was too far to walk as in those days there weren't any cars. On average 60 people worship at the 11 o'clock service which takes place in the summer in the Old Church. The village Church is used the rest of the year. The{Catholic Church}was built in 1964. It's attended by approximately 40 people at each service.The {Methodist Chapel}was built in 1815 with the scool room added later. 20 people worship on average each week membership is much greater many people being ill or too old to attend.The Chapel runs the only{Sunday School}in the village about 40 children attend each week. There used to be another Chapel at Carlidnack but that was knocked down about 10 years ago and a house is built on the site.
